Sentencas: Solid oxide cells (SOCs) have attracted great attention in the past decades because of their high conversion efficiency, low environmental pollution and diversified fuel options.
Titulo: Improving the activity and stability of Ni-based electrodes for solid oxide cells through surface engineering: Recent progress and future perspectives

Sentencas: Nickel-based catalysts are the most widely used fuel electrode materials for SOCs due to the low price and high activity.
Titulo: Improving the activity and stability of Ni-based electrodes for solid oxide cells through surface engineering: Recent progress and future perspectives

Sentencas: However, when hydrocarbon fuels are employed, nickel-based electrodes face serious carbon deposition challenges, leading to a rapid decline of cell performance.
Titulo: Improving the activity and stability of Ni-based electrodes for solid oxide cells through surface engineering: Recent progress and future perspectives

Sentencas: Great efforts have been devoted to understanding the occurrence of the coking reaction, and to improving the stability of the electrodes in hydrocarbon fuels.
Titulo: Improving the activity and stability of Ni-based electrodes for solid oxide cells through surface engineering: Recent progress and future perspectives

Sentencas: In this review, we summarize recent research progress of utilizing surface modification to improve the stability and activity of Ni-based electrodes for SOCs by preventing carbon coking.
Titulo: Improving the activity and stability of Ni-based electrodes for solid oxide cells through surface engineering: Recent progress and future perspectives

Sentencas: The review starts with a briefly introduction about the reaction mechanism of carbon deposition, followed by listing several surface modification technologies and their working principles.
Titulo: Improving the activity and stability of Ni-based electrodes for solid oxide cells through surface engineering: Recent progress and future perspectives

Sentencas: Then we introduce representative works using surface modification strategies to prevent carbon coking on Ni-based electrodes.
Titulo: Improving the activity and stability of Ni-based electrodes for solid oxide cells through surface engineering: Recent progress and future perspectives

Sentencas: Finally, we highlight future direction of improving electrode catalytic activity and anti-coking performance through surface engineering.
Titulo: Improving the activity and stability of Ni-based electrodes for solid oxide cells through surface engineering: Recent progress and future perspectives
